4. Position 5

Position 5
==========

Councilmember Joe Matranga
--------------------------

Joe moved to Friendswood in 1971.  He graduated from Friendswood High School and received a Bachelor of Science degree from Texas A&M University.  Joe and his wife, Paula, raised two daughters who graduated from Friendswood High School and continued their education with one graduating from Texas A&M University and the other from The University of Texas at Austin.

Joe worked 39 years for Occidental Petroleum, a Houston based oil & gas company. He held a variety of positions in plant operations and power plant design, construction and operations. As a Senior Vice President he led Occidental’s power business, with over $1B in assets, that included responsibility for all of the company’s electricity generation, procurement and marketing in North America before retiring in 2019.

Joe began serving on the City of Friendswood ‘s Planning and Zoning Commission in 2017 and was the Commission’s Chairman from 2018 thru 2022.  He served on the board of Friendswood Animal Advocates from 2019 to 2022 and continues to volunteer at Friendswood Animal Control.  Joe joined the board of Friendswood’s West Ranch Management District in 2021 and serves as a Director representing the residents of West Ranch and the citizens of Friendswood.

### Term

May 2023 - May 2026

![Councilmember Joe Matranga](https://www.ci.friendswood.tx.us/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=4883)

### Joe Matranga

Position 5

[Email](mailto:jmatranga@friendswood.com)

**Mailing Address** Friendswood City Hall  
910 S Friendswood Drive  
Friendswood, TX 77546

Phone: (281) 996-3270

**Request for Function Participation**  Individuals and organizations wishing to invite the Mayor or Councilmember(s) to an event or function are asked to submit the online request form.

* [Access Request Form](https://www.ci.friendswood.tx.us/FormCenter/City-Secretary-18/Request-for-Function-Participation-73)

You may [email](mailto:citysecretary@ci.friendswood.tx.us) your request, hand-deliver or mail your request to City Secretary's Office at 910 S. Friendswood Drive, Friendswood, Texas 77546-4856.

Please note that requests must be submitted two weeks in advance. The availability of elected officials is not guaranteed.
